prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant until a year ago. Now she's training to be a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Dr. Turner Grey
Description: The director of the Grey Surgical Clinic where the malpractice incident occurred.
Character 2
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ran away as soon as she saw me. A girl who is Maya's little cousin.
Character 3
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Maya's aunt. She has a strange, powerful aura about her.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. She lives for the next big scoop.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Ini Miney
Description: College student. A huge fan of the occult and is doing research in parapsychology.
Character 7
Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Died in a car accident 1 year ago. Was Ini's older sister, nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.
Character 8
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister. She was a top notch lawyer and my mentor and friend forever.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Became a prosecutor in Germany at age 13. A prodigy who has never known defeat.
Character 10
Name: Ami Fey
Description: Kurain Channeling Technique founder. Legend says her soul is sealed in the Sacred Urn.
Character 11
Name: Director Hotti (purported)
Description: A peculiar patient who claims to be Director Hotti. Seems to be extremely "healthy".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.
Evidence 2
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 3
Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.
Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.
Evidence 5
Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 
Evidence 7
Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.
Evidence 8
Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.
Evidence 11
Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. [caption] It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.
Evidence 12
Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.
Evidence 13
Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her.
Evidence 14
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.
Evidence 15
Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.
Evidence 16
Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.
Evidence 17
Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.
Evidence 18
Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: This is the costume the defendant was wearing at the time of the crime.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: As you can see, it's covered in blood.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. 

First, I'll look through the testimonies given by Gumshoe. Testimony 0 says there's an even more incriminating evidence. Testimony 1 mentions the defendant's costume covered in blood. Testimony 2 reiterates the blood on the costume. Testimony 3 states the defendant attacked someone who wasn't fighting back.

Now, checking the evidences, Evidence 11 (Maya's Costume) describes the costume with blood splatters and a bullet hole. The key point here is that the blood is on the costume, which supports the testimony about blood. However, the contradiction might lie elsewhere.

Wait, the testimony says the costume is "covered in blood," but the evidence description says "stained with blood splatter." "Covered" versus "stained" might be a discrepancy, but that's more about degree. Alternatively, maybe there's another evidence that contradicts.

Looking at Evidence 11's caption again: it mentions blood splatter and a bullet hole but says "the robe is otherwise clean." If the testimony claims it's "covered in blood," that contradicts "otherwise clean." Because "covered" implies more extensive blood, while "stained with blood splatter" and "otherwise clean" suggest limited blood. 

Therefore, Testimony 2 says the costume is "covered in blood," but Evidence 11 states it's only stained with splatter and otherwise clean. That's a contradiction. 

So the answer would be Evidence 11 and Testimony 2. Let me confirm the numbers. Testimony 2 is the second part, so Testimony number 2. Evidence 11 is the costume. 

Wait, the user's instruction says to output in JSON like {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. So the numbers correspond to the evidence and testimony indices. 

Yes, so Evidence 11 is "Maya's Costume" (index 11), and Testimony 2 is Testimony 1's second point (index 2). Wait, need to check the exact numbering again.

Looking back at Testimonies section:

Testimonies:
Testimony 0: "Sorry, pal..."
Testimony 1: "This is the costume..."
Testimony 2: "As you can see, it's covered in blood."
Testimony 3: "The defendant attacked..."

So Testimony 2 is the one stating the costume is covered in blood. The evidence (11) says it's stained with blood splatter and otherwise clean. 

Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 11 and Testimony 2. 

Wait, but the user's previous examples sometimes had different numbering. Let me check the Evidence list again. The evidence numbers start at 0. Evidence 11 is correct. Testimony 2 is the second testimony in the list. 

Thus, the correct pair is evidence 11 and testimony 2.
</think>

Testimony 2

Testimony 3
Testimony: The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: The defendant then picked up on the opening and took the victim's gun, and ended it...

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. So, we need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. Let's start by going through each testimony and see which evidence might conflict with it.

First, looking at the testimonies provided by Gumshoe:

Testimony 0: "During the channeling, the defendant saw her chance to stab the victim in the chest."  
Testimony 1: "Of course, the victim used the last of his strength to fight back, sir."  
Testimony 2: "While the two were fighting, the victim took out his gun."  
Testimony 3: "The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed."  
Testimony 4: "The defendant then picked up on the opening and took the victim's gun, and ended it..."

Now, let's look at the evidence related to the crime. The key pieces here are the autopsy report (Evidence 8), the pistol (Evidence 9), and Maya's costume (Evidence 11). 

Evidence 8 says that Dr. Grey was first stabbed in the chest and then shot in the forehead at point-blank range with gunpowder residue. That means the final shot was very close, which would typically leave a burn mark. 

Evidence 9 mentions the pistol was fired twice, with Maya's and Grey's fingerprints. If Grey shot at Maya but missed (as per Testimony 3), then the two shots could be explained: one missed shot and the final point-blank. However, the autopsy report states the final shot was point-blank, which would require the shooter to be right next to Grey. 

Looking at Testimony 4, Gumshoe claims that Maya took the gun from Grey and ended it. That would mean she fired the final shot. But the autopsy says the final shot was point-blank, so the burn on her costume (Evidence 11) should be present if she was the one holding the gun at that moment. However, the description of the costume mentions a bullet hole but doesn't mention a burn. Wait, actually, the note under Evidence 11 says: "When something is shot from point blank, a burn area is left around the bullet hole." The description of the costume does mention a bullet hole but not a burn. That's a contradiction because if Maya fired point-blank, her sleeve should have a burn, but the evidence says it's just a bullet hole with blood splatter. 

Alternatively, maybe the first shot missed (Testimony 3) was from Grey, and the second shot (the fatal one) was Maya at point-blank. But the costume's bullet hole would still need to have a burn if she fired it point-blank. Since the evidence doesn't mention a burn, that contradicts the testimony where she uses the gun to kill him at point-blank. 

Another angle: The autopsy says he was stabbed first, then shot. If the defendant stabbed him, then took the gun and shot him point-blank, the final shot's burn should be on her. Since her costume has a bullet hole but no burn, that's a contradiction. 

Alternatively, maybe the bullet hole in her costume is from Grey's missed shot. If he fired first, missed, and the bullet went through her sleeve (hence the hole without a burn because it was from a distance), then the final shot by Maya would have a burn, but that's on Grey's body, not her costume. Wait, but the costume's bullet hole is in the sleeve. If Grey shot at her from a distance, the hole wouldn't have a burn. The final shot by Maya at point-blank would be on Grey, not her. So the hole in her costume could be from Grey's missed shot, which was from a distance. That would make sense. However, the testimony says that the victim (Grey) took a shot but missed. So that aligns with the bullet hole in her costume being from his shot. But then the final shot by Maya would be point-blank on Grey, which the autopsy supports. 

Wait, but the problem is the testimony says the defendant took the gun and ended it, implying she fired the final shot. The evidence (autopsy) says the final shot was point-blank. If she did that, her sleeve should have a burn from the gun's muzzle, but the evidence description says there's a bullet hole but no mention of a burn. The note in Evidence 11 specifically states that a point-blank shot leaves a burn. Since the costume's description doesn't mention a burn, this is a contradiction. 

So, the contradiction is between Testimony 4 (defendant fired the final shot point-blank) and Evidence 11 (costume has a bullet hole without a burn, implying the shot wasn't point-blank from her side). 

Alternatively, maybe the bullet hole in the costume is from Grey's shot, which was a miss (so not point-blank), and the final shot by Maya was point-blank on Grey, so the burn would be on his body, not her clothes. In that case, the costume's bullet hole (from Grey's shot) doesn't need a burn, and the autopsy's point-blank is okay. 

Hmm, so maybe Testimony 4 is contradicted by Evidence 11? Because if Maya fired point-blank, her costume should have the burn, but it doesn't. Therefore, the testimony that she fired the final shot (point-blank) contradicts the evidence that her costume's bullet hole lacks the burn. 

Alternatively, maybe the evidence about the costume's bullet hole not having a burn suggests that the bullet came from a distance, so the final shot wasn't by her. Therefore, the testimony that she took the gun and ended it (fired point-blank) would be contradicted by the evidence. 

So the pair would be Evidence 11 and Testimony 4. 

Wait, the user's previous answers used the JSON format like {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. Let me confirm numbering:

The testimonies are numbered 0 to 4 (Testimony 0 to Testimony 4). The user wants the testimony number as per the list given. 

So Testimony 4 is the one where Gumshoe says the defendant took the gun and ended it (the final shot). 

Evidence 11 is Maya's Costume, which has a bullet hole but no burn (since the note says point-blank leaves a burn, but the description doesn't mention it). Therefore, if she fired point-blank, there should be a burn, but there isn't. Thus, the testimony that she fired the final shot (Testimony 4) contradicts Evidence 11. 

Alternatively, maybe the bullet hole in the costume is from Grey's missed shot (Testimony 3 says he shot but missed). That shot would be from a distance, so no burn. Then the final shot by Maya would have a burn on Grey's body but not on her clothes, which is okay. Therefore, that doesn't contradict. 

The contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 11. 

Another point: The autopsy report says the victim was shot in the forehead at point-blank. So the shooter was right next to him. If Maya did that, she would have gunpowder residue on her, but the costume's description doesn't mention that. However, the evidence about the pistol (Evidence 9) has her fingerprints, so she handled it, but the burn on the costume is the key point. 

Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 11 and Testimony 4. The JSON should be {"evidence": 11, "testimony":4}.
</think>
